page.title: 11BRIDPORT
page.content:
Bridport was famous for it's {rope-making industry}which have been made in the town since{1211.}Rope and nets are still made in the town. The amount od space needed to make rope and nets explains why Bridport has such{wide streets.}
Bridport has a{museum}and an{art {gallery.} A street market is held every Wednesday and Saturday morning.
{Thomas Hardy}called Bridport "Port Bredy" in his novels.
It is a centre for tourism and the {River Brit}flows down to{West Bay } where there is a harbour.
